required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Similarities and Differences of Biological Therapies for Severe Asthma.
clinical_study.official_title: Similarities and Differences of Biological Therapies for Severe Asthma.

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

clinical_study.source: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

brief_summary.textblock: This is an ambispective multicenter longitudinal observational study to evaluate the efficacy and safety profile of biological therapies in patients diagnosed with severe asthma in real life conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
The use of biologicals to treat severe asthma has been implemented in a regular basis while information on long term effectiveness and safety is lacking. It is necessary to establish strategies to closely monitor the possible occurrence of reactions, adverse effects of innovative biological medicines used to treat severe asthma.
In this study the investigators want to evaluate the comparative effectiveness, utilization patterns, long-term safety, and use in special groups in real-life conditions in severe asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment dose scheduling and changes of dose throughout the study.
Number of treatment discontinuations and causes of interruption throughout the study.
Incidence of Relevant Treatment-Related Adverse Events recorded throughout the study.
Severity of Treatment-Related Adverse Events recorded throughout the study.
Change of asthma control during the treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Number of asthma exacerbations, change in FEV1, ACT, and blood eosinophilia, need of add-on medication, inhaled medication and systemic corticosteroids.

arm_group.description: Patients with severe asthma being treated with non-biological standard therapies, mainly systemic corticosteroids.
Patients with severe asthma being treated with omalizumab, mepolizumab, reslizumab, benralizumab, or dupilumab.

intervention.description: Mepolizumab will be prescribed freely by the treating physician according to real-life conditions.
Omalizumab will be prescribed freely by the treating physician according to real-life conditions.
Reslizumab will be prescribed freely by the treating physician according to real-life conditions.
Benralizumab will be prescribed freely by the treating physician according to real-life conditions.
Dupilumab will be prescribed freely by the treating physician according to real-life conditions.

study_pop.textblock: All patients, adults and children, with a diagnosis of severe asthma in the participating centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals of any age: adults and children.
- Diagnosis of severe asthma as given by the treating physician, and defined as an asthma that remains uncontrolled in despite adherence with maximal optimized therapy and treatment of contributed factors, or asthma that worsens when high dose treatment is decreased.
- Being treated or not (control group) with biological drugs.
- Signed Informed Consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None.

facility.name: Hospital Civil-Hospital Regional Universitario de Málaga
